title: Team
metaDescription: Meet the PuppetPlays project team: researchers, postdoctoral fellows, and academic partners working on the history of puppet theatre in Europe.
introduction: Our international team brings together passionate researchers and experts in the field of puppet theatre, under the direction of Professor Didier Plassard at University Paul-Valéry Montpellier 3.

teamMembers.title: Team Members
teamMembers.description: The PuppetPlays team brings together international specialists in puppet theatre, cultural history, and digital humanities.

scientificCommittee.title: Scientific Committee
scientificCommittee.description: The scientific committee provides expertise and guidance to the PuppetPlays project, ensuring academic rigor and international collaboration.

partners.title: Partners
partners.description: The PuppetPlays project is made possible through the support of our partners and funding institutions.

acknowledgments.title: Acknowledgments
acknowledgments.content: The PuppetPlays project would like to extend its warmest thanks to all the interns and part-time workers who have contributed to the creation of this database through their rigorous work and commitment: Ambrine Altruda, Talia Bernard, Salya Chafai-Nefnaf, Fiona Gazzaniga, Vagia Grounidou, Sofiia Hultiaieva, Orane Larue, Morgane Le Bots, Lynda Magne, Anaïs Malfatti, Pierre Massinon, Manon Nafraicheur, Elane Ouamrane, Shivam Pirmez, Aurora Lily Sabath, Galina Safarian, Youcef Tabti, Natacha Tell, Victorin Thillot, Noor Zenasni-Coplo.

partnersNote: This project has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement No 835193).
